author: Varun Arora
title: Zomato integrates Paytm wallet for food payments
text:
Home > Mobile > Zomato integrates Paytm wallet for food payments Zomato integrates Paytm wallet for food payments | 0 Comments Paytm has over 100 million mobile wallet users 
Restaurant listings and review firm Zomato , which also allows users to order food, will now enable its customers to pay using Paytm mobile wallet. 
This makes Paytm the first virtual wallet property to sign up with Zomato for food delivery payments, as per a press statement. 
Paytm , which is run by One97 Communications Ltd, is already a payment option for customers of Gurgaon-based food delivery service Foodpanda. 
“At Zomato, we look to create seamless and delightful customer experiences, and integrating Paytm Wallet into our product is another step in that direction. Customers can now use Zomato to order online from a huge number of restaurants, and enjoy the convenience of making completely cashless payments using the Paytm wallet,” said Tanmay Saksena, global business head, Zomato Order, which is run by Zomato Media Pvt Ltd. 
In May, Zomato launched a new app called Order, allowing users to order food through its platform. The service is currently operational in Delhi NCR, Hyderabad, Kolkata, Chennai, Bangalore, Chandigarh, Jaipur, Kochi, Lucknow, Ahmedabad, Coimbatore and Indore. 
Just like countless other food ordering apps, Zomato Order too enables users to view menus and ratings, and order for free from a range of restaurants. Customers can search by restaurant name or location, and see places that deliver to their location; give their current location or select a new location for delivery; add frequently used locations to their address book for quick orders; track order status with real-time notifications; and see all previous orders and reorder from the list. Zomato recently invested in hyperlocal delivery startups Pickingo and Grab while partnering with e-commerce logistics firm Delhivery . 
The Paytm wallet option is in addition to the existing payment options such as credit/debit cards, net banking and cash on delivery at Zomato. “We are delighted to integrate Paytm Wallet on Zomato. It’s the leading food discovery and ordering platform in India, and has the largest consumer base in this space. Food ordering is a prime use case for Paytm wallet users, and the association with Zomato will be great for our users. This is in sync with our mission of moving towards a cashless environment in India,” Amit Lakhotia, vice president, Paytm. 
Paytm recently crossed the 100 million users threshold for its mobile wallet.
